body: Story 6/10 | Art 8/10 | Characters 9/10 | Enjoyment 4/10 | Overall 7.2/10 | I don't know man, the story is kinda weird. I mean like really weird for some reason, feels like a fever dream or something. But I know someone to there is nutting to this so I respect that. Beside from the weirdness, its got everything right. From the character personality all the way to their development, which is why I feel weird because the dialogue is all uncanny. For art, its not the best out there but still doing a decent jobs with the drawing. I can tell what's what. I don't really enjoy this doujin, the reason is above

I can't seem to understand what people would find "fucked up" about this? There are only two slightly questionable things in this. 

Firstly the fact that Yocchan thinks Riri likes her more as a cat, this ends up having no real consequences and is quickly cleared up, plus it's just a simple misunderstanding to the fault of no-one, it would only be considered "fucked up" by me if this was intentionally done by Riri, which it clearly wasn't.

The second is the only part I consider slightly fucked up. Riris response to this, basically just page 27. This seems to come out of the blue, but could be explained away with her being emotional due to the previous reveal. The way she takes the cat play hostage is kinda bordering on some abusive tendencies, but it's very mild, and it's clearly shown that she regrets it immediately. She even ends up stopping her (and apologizes) before it has any consequences at all. So she did something bad and fixed it immediately, not really "fucked up"

So the diary at the end. 

I think the mistress purposely left it out in the open for the catslave to find it as a roleplay device. We never saw the diary before that page as the mistress kept it hidden from both the catslave and us the readers. 

As the title says, it is a training diary, and probably has her thoughts on the slave's progress, what she thinks and feels about the roleplays, and maybe future roleplays. I'd like to think that on the very last page, the mistress wrote, "Behind you" for the epic troll.

But that's only a theory, a doujin theory! Thanks for reading :3

BDSM Fact: Training diaries are an actual thing in bdsm, but they are for the slave to write in about how they feel during the roleplay. Things like what was good, embarrassing, scary,  or difficult, as a way for the master/mistress to see their progress and how feel indirectly.

Other than the watersports I think this one's pretty good, because it bothers to act like exposing oneself as a pervert to one's friends is a really good idea. In reality, it's always a bad idea to just casually inform people you're getting fucked like a cat. It's also kind of like inviting them to a three way or forcing them.

Since the other person is being effectively used for your own gratification (at their expense, they might not want to know), then it's kind of rude. It's like, telling your friend you farted or something disgusting, for a cheap thrill. Now I'm sure you're not one of those prudes that no-one likes, who is too ashamed of a fart joke that they lose friends over it. But come on, wagging your butt plug around their face is probably just turning into a weirdo.

This manga accomplishes that sense of realism.

I mean in the best case scenario these friends get onboard with it and teasing happens later, and no-one's feelings get hurt. True love.
